title: Tuning proton behavior in a ternary molecular complex.
abstract:
noThe multicomponent ternary complex of 4-dimethylaminobenzoic acid (4-DABA), 3,5-dinitrobenzoic acid\ud
(3,5-DNBA), and 4,40-bipyridine (BIPY) has been studied by variable temperature X-ray and neutron diffraction. Proton disorder is\ud
observed within the 4-DABA homodimers present and quantitatively evaluated from neutron data. The effect of the crystal\ud
environment and in particular the pyramidalization of the nitrogen atom within the 4-DABA molecule and the consequential\ud
effect on the presence of hydrogen atom disorder are discussed with reference to the previously determined pure 4-DABA\ud
structure and the binary cocrystal with 3,5-DNBA
